TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ToolboxItem extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

Docs.summary: Provides a base implementation of a toolbox item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is a base class for toolbox items that can be displayed in the toolbox of a design-time environment. A toolbox item typically represents a component to create when invoked on a design mode document. The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class provides the methods and properties needed to provide the toolbox with the display properties for the toolbox item, to create a component or components when used, and to serialize and deserialize itself for persistence within the toolbox database.
An instance of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class can be configured with a name, bitmap, and type to create, without creating a class that derives from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class also provides a base class for custom toolbox item implementations. A custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> can create multiple components. To implement a custom toolbox item, you must derive from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> and override the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A>, <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Serialize%2A>, and <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Deserialize%2A> methods.
The following properties and methods must be configured for a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> to function correctly:
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property specifies the label for the toolbox item when displayed in a toolbox.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property specifies the fully qualified name of the type of the component that the item creates. If a derived class creates multiple components, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property may or may not be used, contingent on whether a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method override depends on the value of this property.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property specifies the assembly that contains the type of a component that the item creates.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Bitmap%2A> property optionally specifies a bitmap image to display next to the display name for the toolbox item in the toolbox.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property optionally contains any <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> objects that determine whether the toolbox item can be used on a particular component.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method returns the component instance or instances to insert where this tool is used.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Serialize%2A> method saves the toolbox item to a specified <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Deserialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item from the state information contained in the specified <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo>.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Initialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item to create the specified type of component, if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has not been overridden to behave differently.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Locked%2A> property indicates whether the properties of the toolbox item can be changed. A toolbox item is typically locked after it is added to a toolbox.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Lock%2A> method locks a toolbox item.
- The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CheckUnlocked%2A> method throws an exception if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Locked%2A> property is `true`.
## Examples The following code example provides a component that uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.IToolboxService> interface to add a text data format handler, or <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreatorCallback>, to the toolbox. The data creator callback delegate passes any text data pasted to the toolbox and dragged onto a form to a custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that creates a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> containing the text.
[!code-cpp[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/CPP/textdatatextboxcomponent.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/CS/textdatatextboxcomponent.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ToolboxCreatorCallbackSample/VB/textdatatextboxcomponent.vb#1)]
The following code example demonstrates the use of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class as a base class for a custom toolbox item implementation.
[!code-csharp[System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem/CS/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem/VB/Form1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Reflection::AssemblyName ^ AssemblyName { System::Reflection::AssemblyName ^ get(); void set(System::Reflection::AssemblyName ^ value); };
member this.AssemblyName : System.Reflection.AssemblyName with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the assembly that contains the type or types that the toolbox item creates.
Docs.value: An that indicates the assembly containing the type or types to create.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property specifies the assembly that contains the types of the components to create.

block.para: If your derived toolbox item class creates multiple components that are located in different assemblies, you must ensure that references to these assemblies exist in your project. It is advisable to add these references from an overload of the method. Even if your method does not depend on the value of the property, you should ensure that this property is set to the assembly that one of the components to create belongs to, because it is displayed in the **Customize Toolbox** dialog box in Visual Studio.

Docs.value: The display name for the toolbox item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property indicates the string that is displayed for the toolbox item in the toolbox.
By default, the base <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> class sets its <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property to a short form of the fully qualified type name specified by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property.

member this.Filter : System.Collections.ICollection with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the filter that determines whether the toolbox item can be used on a destination component.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property collection contains <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> objects that specify the policy that the design-time environment uses to determine whether a toolbox item can be used on the destination component.
For more information on restricting the scope in which a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> can be used, see the documentation for the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Initialize(class System.Type type) cil managed
abstract member Initialize : Type -> unit override this.Initialize : Type -> unit

Docs.param: The that the toolbox item creates.
Docs.summary: Initializes the current toolbox item with the specified type to create.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Initialize%2A> method configures the toolbox item to create the specified type, if the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has not been overridden to behave differently.
This method performs the following operations:
- Sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.AssemblyName%2A> property to an <xref:System.Reflection.AssemblyName> indicating the assembly of the specified type.
- Sets the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.DisplayName%2A> property to a short type name based on the name of the specified type.
- Adds any <xref:System.ComponentModel.ToolboxItemFilterAttribute> attributes found on the specified type to the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Filter%2A> property collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnComponentsCreated(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs args) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnComponentsCreated (args As ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs)

abstract member OnComponentsCreated : System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs -> unit override this.OnComponentsCreated : System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that provides data for the event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreated%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreated> event. This method is called after a toolbox item is invoked to create components and the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method has returned.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreated%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnComponentsCreating(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatingEventArgs args) cil managed
Protected Overridable Sub OnComponentsCreating (args As ToolboxComponentsCreatingEventArgs)

abstract member OnComponentsCreating : System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatingEventArgs -> unit override this.OnComponentsCreating : System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxComponentsCreatingEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that provides data for the event.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreating%2A> method raises the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ComponentsCreating> event. This method is called after a toolbox item is invoked to create components, just before the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponentsCore%2A> method is called.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.OnComponentsCreating%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

block.para: When overriding in a derived class, be sure to call the base class' method so that registered delegates receive the event.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the original bitmap that will be used in the toolbox for this item.
Docs.value: A that represents the toolbox item in the toolbox.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This bitmap should be 16x16 pixels and should be used in the Visual Studio toolbox, not on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Properties As IDictionary
public: property System::Collections::IDictionary ^ Properties { System::Collections::IDictionary ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a dictionary of properties.
Docs.value: A dictionary of name/value pairs (the names are property names and the values are property values).

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.Properties%2A> property dictionary becomes read-only after the toolbox item has been locked.
Values in the properties dictionary are validated through the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyValue%2A> method, and default values are obtained from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetDefaultProperty%2A> method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.TypeName%2A> property specifies the fully qualified type name of the type of component to create.

block.para: If a derived toolbox item class creates multiple components, this property must be set unless your method override does not depend on the value of this property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.ValidatePropertyValue%2A> method is called whenever a value is set in the property dictionary. With this method, you can change the value of an object before committing it, or reject it by throwing an exception.
